Description: Foundation for modular architecture, authentication, routing, global layout
As a developer, I want a monorepo scaffold with workspace packages so that I can build modular frontend packages and manage dependencies cleanly.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Setup packages: app-shell, ui-core, shared-types. 2. Configure TypeScript and build tools.

Summary: Login / logout flow with token storage
Description: As a user, I want a login / logout flow with token storage and role-based routing so that access control is enforced across front-end.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Implement login screen. 2. Store tokens securely. 3. Redirect based on role.

Summary: Linting + TypeScript strict mode + basic CI
Description: As a developer, I want linting + TypeScript strict mode + basic CI pipeline so that code quality is maintained.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Configure ESLint and Prettier. 2. Enable TS strict mode. 3. Setup CI pipeline.

Description: Build core scanning, session management, item lookup, line save flows

Summary: Select floor & rack and start a session
Description: As a staff auditor, I want to select floor & rack and start a session so that I can begin inventory for that rack.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. UI for floor/rack selection. 2. Session header component.

Summary: Scan or manually enter barcode / search item
Description: As a staff auditor, I want to scan or manually enter barcode / search item name / enter serial so that scanning is flexible.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Support camera scanning. 2. Support manual barcode entry. 3. Support item name search.

Description: As a staff auditor, I want to see item details (name, barcode, system qty) before counting so that I have correct context.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Display item metadata after lookup. 2. Show system stock quantity.

Description: damaged qty
Acceptance Criteria: condition
column5: As a staff auditor, I want to enter physical qty, damaged qty, condition, optional note so that I can record accurate inventory state.
column6: 1. Form validation for quantity. 2. Optional damage and remark fields.

Summary: Save the line to session (online or offline)
Description: As a staff auditor, I want to save the line to session so that my work isn’t lost if network fails.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Save API integration. 2. Offline queue fallback.

Description: Ensure usability in unreliable network conditions
As a staff auditor, I want the app to work offline and queue operations so that I can continue counting without connectivity.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Implement local queue (IndexedDB/AsyncStorage). 2. Background sync logic.

Description: As a frontend user, I want to see sync status so that I know whether my data is safe or pending sync.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. UI status indicator. 2. Manual retry button.

Description: As a team, I want the sync workflow to detect conflicts from server and surface them for supervisor review.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Handle 409/422 responses. 2. Notification system for conflicts.

Description: Enable multiple staff to work on same session concurrently

Summary: See who else is auditing the same rack
Description: As a staff member, I want to see who else is currently auditing the same rack so that I avoid duplicate counts.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. WebSocket presence channel. 2. UI list of active staff.

Description: As a developer, I want soft-locking on line edits so that simultaneous edits don’t lead to silent overwrite.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Soft-lock logic on edit start.

Description: As a team, we want live update of lines created/modified by other staff so all clients stay in sync.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Broadcast WS events. 2. Real-time UI updates.

Description: Tools for review, reconciliation, and oversight
As a supervisor, I want a pending-variance list UI so that I can review inconsistencies flagged by staff.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Variance list with filters.

Description: As a supervisor, I want a diff view for each variance so I can approve, reject, or request resolution.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Side-by-side comparison UI.

Description: As a supervisor, I want to approve or reject a variance so that changes are audited and controlled.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Approval/Rejection actions. 2. Audit logging.

Description: As a supervisor, I want to raise a recount request for any line or rack so staff can re-audit suspicious entries.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Recount creation flow.

Description: As a staff auditor, I want an inbox for recount requests so I can accept and perform recount on demand.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Staff notification/list view.

Description: As a staff auditor, I want a recount workbench so I can re-validate entries.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Specialized scanning UI for recounts.

Description: Provide administrative controls, reporting, configuration
As an admin, I want a feature-toggle & config UI so I can manage system behavior without code deploy.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Config panel with persistence.

Description: As an admin, I want reports on conflicts, temp-items, staff productivity so I can monitor health.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Dashboard analytics. 2. Export options.

Description: As an admin, I want role & permission management UI so I can assign/revoke privileges.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. User management interface.

Description: Build a professional-grade development pipeline
As a developer, I want full CI pipeline so that code quality is automatically validated.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. GitHub Actions/GitLab CI setup. 2. Lint/Test/Build steps.

Description: As a dev team, we want shared types generated from backend OpenAPI so frontend / backend stay in sync.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. OpenAPI codegen integration.

Summary: E2E test skeleton for core flows
Description: As a QA, I want an E2E test skeleton for core flows so regression is minimized.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. Cypress/Playwright setup. 2. Basic happy-path tests.
